title.narrative: F.a: Organising Transport Sector in Thailand

description.narrative: The project develops union cooperation and trade unions in the Thai transport sector with the aim that the worker groups in public and private transport companies will get organised.The political situation in Thailand has been subject to continuing changes , conflicts and even military coups for a long time. This has resulted in weak union structures and development, low organizing rates particularly in the private sectors and weak operational capacity. This project will enhance union capacities, recruitment union cooperation and joint action. Particularly the private sectors and atypical work forms will be will be addressed.By educating trainers, the project ensures the forming of a permanent and efficient organizer pool (45 trainers) and a network, tailored and planned organizer campaigns and basic training for trade unions. This way, the increase in members, the presence of the labour movement in new transport companies and the start of collective bargaining is guaranteed. The cooperation between old and ne w unions supports member recruitment as a whole. Beneficiaries are the organised and unorganised workers, trained organisers, TU activists and their unions in the transport sector (railway, road transport, subway, money transport, harbor and airways). ITF pays special attention to the participation of the young and aims at a 30% share of female participants in all project operations. The main partner is the International Transport Workers' Federation (ITF) and its ten affiliates in Thailand.
